jobDetails.jobDescription: The RoleWe are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior AEM Fullstack Engineer, Web to join our team and lead the development, maintenance, and enhancement of our Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AEM and web development, with a proven ability to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.You will be spearheading efforts to improve team collaboration and act as a bridge between the US and India-based teams, ensuring seamless communication and coordination across time zones.Our team focuses on increasing our ability to move quickly, solving challenging marketing initiatives, and pushing the envelope of value provided to prospects and customers visiting our corporate website www.moveworks.com. Your work will impact Moveworks' brand presence and will clearly communicate what challenges we solve for our customers, in deep collaboration with other functions within Moveworks.What You Will DoSpearhead the development of the existing MarTech stack anchored by Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)Contribute to the long-term and short term development roadmap planning against web marketing priorities and company targetsParticipate in the full development lifecycle: from estimation, design, development, testing, to deployment, quality assurance and testingBuild, test, and implement custom components, templates, workflows, multi-site management and integrations using AEMProvide regular maintenance of the content management system (CMS) including infrastructure updates combined with security fixes on a quarterly basisResponse for security / failure / unpack event and other application issuesLead the integration and optimization of new CMS features and third-party tools to enhance lead generation capability.Collaborate closely with cross-functional (XFN) partners such as web marketing and brand team to create enterprise level UX on moveworks.com for improved conversionWhat You Bring To The Table4-5 years of web development experience with 2+ years of experience in AEM (AEMaaCS preferred)Candidates should have implemented at least 2 full cycle AEM projectsSolid experience with AEM building blocks Java Content Repository, Sling web framework and Apache Felix OSGi framework, DAM, Workflows, Dynamic MediaStrong Java skillsMust have experience in Unix OS to troubleshoot application issues, certificate issues, performance issuesShould have strong experience of AEM setup /configuration, caching and performance optimizationExperience in writing AEM Dispatcher rules as well as having hands-on experience with Apache Web Server/Nginx redirection and other relevant modulesIn-depth knowledge of web accessibility and SEO best practicesExperience integrating Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics with AEMExperience with integrating Adobe Target is not required, but consider it a huge plusExperience working with geographically separate project and engineering teamsBase salary compensation range: $200,000 - $249,000Our compensation package includes a market competitive salary, equity for all full time roles, exceptional benefits, and, for applicable roles, commissions or bonus plans.Ultimately, in determining pay, final offers may vary from the amount listed based on geography, the role’s scope and complexity, the candidate’s experience and expertise, and other factors.Moveworks Is An Equal Opportunity EmployerMoveworks is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.Who We AreMoveworks is the universal AI copilot for search and automation across all your business applications. We give employees one place to go to find information and get support while reducing costs for your business. The Moveworks Copilot is powered by an industry-leading Reasoning Engine that uses a combination of public and proprietary language models to understand employee queries, then build and execute multi-step plans that achieve them. It does this by linking into systems (like ITSM, HRIS, ERP, identity management, and more) with native and custom-built integrations that turn natural language into powerful automations for employees.The world’s most innovative brands like Databricks, Broadcom, Hearst, and Palo Alto Networks trust Moveworks to eliminate repetitive support issues, deliver instant knowledge, and empower employees to work faster across applications.Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion, thanks to our award-winning product and team. In 2023, we were included in the Forbes Cloud 100 list as well as the Forbes AI 50 for the fifth consecutive year. We were also recognized by the 2023 Edison Awards for AI Optimized Productivity, and were included on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies list for 2024!Moveworks has over 500 employees in six offices around the world, and is backed by some of the world's most prominent investors, including Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed, Bain Capital Ventures, Sapphire Ventures, Iconiq, and more.Come join one of the most innovative teams on the planet!
